PositiveEntailmentTest.purpose: This test highlights the different behavior of forward-chaining vs. backward-chaining engines
PositiveEntailmentTest.description: The entailment holds, but some engines may have difficulty finding it and/or may behave badly with it. This particular test case may be hard to handle for backward-chaining engines, depending on their implementation of the func:numeric-subtract builtin. In a forward-chaining strategy, the entailment should be found. Note that a backward-chaining engine, which is able to handle the external built-in in the head would avoid non-termination problems on arbitrary other entailment tests with this ruleset by the termination condition in the body.
